page.title: 20BEAUTIFUL CATTERICK-TUNSTALL
page.content: The landscape is constantly changing with the seasons giving the countryside a different appearance as the year progresses. Being a farming area the view changes as the soil is first ploughed to a rich brown then a coat of green appears as the newly planted seeds ripen and grow. Grass becomes a lush green, the oil seed rape turns a field into a blaze of yellow and the gold of the corn fields , of the oats, barley and wheat, makes a colourful carpet over the land. The trees also change over the seasons, from the pale green shades of spring to the autumn browns. Springtime is spectacular, with the blossom of the cherry and almond trees producing a pink froth. The crocuses and the daffodils growing along by the beck complement natures beauty.
